oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Community Leadership Activities Summary
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Summary of community leadership activities involving Esau Jenkins on Johns Island, South Carolina, through March 1955. This plan documents Highlander's association with Jenkins, including voter registration drives and visits to Charleston from both Zilphia and Myles Horton. The document includes Highlander's future plans regarding community outreach in the Sea Islands.

Esau Jenkins was a South Carolina businessman, community organizer, and civil and human rights leader. His primary mission was to help the African American community of the Sea Islands around Charleston, South Carolina. He purchased buses to send them to better schools in the city. Local Septima Clark recruited him through Highlander to run citizenship schools and voter registration drives in his area to increase civic literacy and voter turnout
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Literacy tests (Election law); Jenkins, Esau, 1910-1972; Voter registration; Community leadership; Sea Islands; Johns Island (S.C.); Civil rights
